TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ToolboxItemContainer extends System.Object implements class System.Runtime.Serialization.ISerializable

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> is a simple class that encapsulates a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> for efficiency. By having a single class that is always loaded, you can defer the loading of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> until it is needed. Because new classes can be derived from <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, you could load a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that could, in turn, load an assembly that is not already in memory. For a large collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> objects, this could cause a large number of assemblies to be loaded, which decreases performance. Instead, the toolbox service deals only with <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects and retrieves their contained <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> only when necessary.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> is designed to hold any cached data from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The default implementation only holds the filter of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, but deriving classes may choose to cache the name, image, and other information. <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects support two forms of serialization: they can be serialized through standard runtime serialization, and they can also load and save themselves from a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject?displayProperty=nameWithType>. The former provides a very easy way to save <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects to a persistent storage. The latter provides a way to integrate <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> objects with mixed data storage formats.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The container's cache of information is filled by accessing properties on the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Forms.IDataObject data) cil managed

Docs.param: A data object that represents a .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `data` parameter may contain data provided by the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer> class. It may contain data that can be read by one of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that have been supplied by the user. It may also be data with a clipboard format that has a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creator assigned to it. In this case, the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is created on demand.

block.para: Generally, it is not necessary to override the serialization mechanism for a . objects implement serialization by saving the returned from the property. When you override and provide your own custom data, this data is included with the default implementation. Override the default serialization implementation only if you intend to store private details about this that should not be exposed through the public data object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `creators` parameter is a collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> objects that represent any custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that should be included when the filter is generated. Custom creators may contribute to the filters. This parameter can be `null` if no creators are needed.
The types stored in a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> may have a filter associated with them. Filters can be used to restrict the tools that can be placed on designers.

block.para: Generally, it is not necessary to override the serialization mechanism for a class. Instead, override the property and add your own data to the data object. The method internally uses the property to create the serialization info. Override only if you want to save private information about the that should not be saved as part of the public data object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem GetToolboxItem(class System.Collections.ICollection creators) cil managed
Public Overridable Function GetToolboxItem (creators As ICollection) As ToolboxItem
abstract member GetToolboxItem : System.Collections.ICollection -> System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem override this.GetToolboxItem : System.Collections.ICollection -> System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem

remarks.format:
## Remarks The `creators` parameter is a collection of <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemCreator> objects that represent any custom <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> creators that should be included when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is obtained. This parameter can be `null` if no creators are needed.
The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.GetToolboxItem%2A> method returns a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> that represents the data stored in the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer>. <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.GetToolboxItem%2A> never returns `null`, nor does it ever raise an exception, except in extreme cases (for example, out of memory). If a <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> cannot be fabricated, the appropriate exception is embedded within a special <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The exception is thrown when the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem.CreateComponents%2A> method on this special <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem> is called. This puts the exception at the point of user action.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property ToolboxData As IDataObject
public: virtual property System::Windows::Forms::IDataObject ^ ToolboxData { System::Windows::Forms::IDataObject ^ get(); };

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.ToolboxData%2A> property creates the serialized version of the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. The data object can be used by an application to store this <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>. This data object is fabricated from the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem>, if necessary.

block.para: Implementers may override this to provide additional storage information in the data object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void UpdateFilter(class System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItem item) cil managed

Docs.param: The source of the filter to merge with the container's filter.
Docs.summary: Merges the container's filter with the filter from the given item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You should call the <xref:System.Drawing.Design.ToolboxItemContainer.UpdateFilter%2A> method when the toolbox item is modified or configured. You should also call it if a new <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptionProvider>, which the changes the filter, is added.
